773.01  DEFINITIONS.
   Unless otherwise expressly stated, the following definitions shall be
applicable to this chapter:
   (a)    "Taxicab" means and includes all motor-driven vehicles engaged in the
business of carrying passengers for hire on the streets of the City. "Taxicab",
as defined in this chapter, does not include any of the following:
      (1)    Vehicles such as, but not limited to limousines, which are
exclusively for hire in connection with special or ceremonial events such as
weddings, high school proms, transportation of dignitaries, anniversaries or
funerals;
      (2)    Vehicles such as, but not limited to, buses which operate upon
City streets.
      (3)    Private vehicle(s) belonging to the passenger which are driven by
a chauffeur; the chauffeur being the employee of the passenger and therefore
capable of being hired or fired from employment by the passenger.
      (4)    Vehicles engaged exclusively in the transportation of freight; or
      (5)    The transportation of persons characterized by the use of only
one's private motor vehicles, titled in the driver's name and operated
exclusively on an irregular, infrequent or occasional basis to transport
friends, relatives or acquaintances of the vehicle owner/driver, with the
owner/driver neither having or using any other means of advertisement
suggesting an intention, desire or willingness to operate a taxicab company,
and which activity is not connected in any manner with a passenger or freight
transportation business.
   (b)    "Taxicab Owner/Operator " means any person, firm or corporation who
or which has control, direction of operation, maintenance or the benefit of the
collection of revenue derived from the operation of a taxicab, on or over the
streets of the City, whether as owner, operator, licensee or otherwise, except
a driver as hereinafter defined.
   (c)    "Taxicab Driver" means any person authorized and assigned to drive a
taxicab, and includes every person actually in charge of the physical operation
of a taxicab, whether as owner, agent, sub-agent, servant, independent
contractor to or employee of the owner.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.02  SCOPE.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to taxicabs from other
jurisdictions, and having no City license, bringing passengers into the City.
But this chapter shall apply and no taxicab owner/operator or taxicab driver
shall solicit or accept any passengers within the City of East Liverpool, for
any destination without first obtaining the necessary licenses required by this
chapter.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.03  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)    Owner/Operator License. No person, firm, partnership or corporation
shall engage in the business of owning or operating one or more taxicab
companies within the City without first procuring or renewing and maintaining
in full force and effect a taxicab owner/operator license, which license shall
be granted by the Mayor.
   (b)    Driver's License. No taxicab shall be operated by the driver within
the City without first procuring or renewing and maintaining in full force and
effect, a taxicab driver's license, which license shall be granted by the Mayor
and an operator's license issued by the State of Ohio.
   (c)    Use of Unlicensed Taxicabs Prohibited. No person as owner/operator of
a taxicab company shall permit the operation of, nor shall any taxicab driver
operate, an unlicensed taxicab for purposes of conveying passengers or
property, for hire, to any destination within the City.
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.04  APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
    (a)    Every person, firm, partnership or corporation desiring to drive a
taxicab, or to manage or engage in the business of operating a taxicab company
shall submit an application for the appropriate license to the Mayor on a form
provided for that purpose. The applicant shall answer all questions in the
application. When an application for a taxicab owner/operator license is made
on behalf of a corporation or partnership, the names and addresses of all
officers or partners shall be included. The trade name under which the business
shall be
operated shall also be stated.
   (b)    Upon receipt of the application, the Mayor shall cause to be made
such investigation of the applicant as is necessary to determine whether the
applicant meets the requirements set forth in this chapter.  (Ord. 72, 1998. 
Passed 11-16-98.)
773.05  REQUIREMENTS FOR TAXICAB DRIVER'S LICENSE.
   (a)    An applicant for the initial issuance or renewal of a taxicab
driver's license shall meet the following requirements:
      (1 )    Be an American citizen and able to speak and read the English
language;
      (2)    Be twenty-one or more years of age;
      (3)    Be in sound physical condition, have good eyesight and not subject
to any infirmity, defect or disorder of mind or body which might reasonably
render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of driving a
taxicab, as determined by the Mayor from all reliable medical, psychological or
health information supplied by the driver or other persons concerning the
driver's physical or mental condition.
      (4)    Possess a valid state operator's license;
      (5)    Such applicant must be of good character;
      (6)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
constituting a felony.
      (7)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
involving the use, possession of or sale of a controlled substance;
      (8)    Such applicant shall not be involved in a pending court action for
any criminal offense;
      (9)    Such applicant, within two years prior to filing the application
for a license, shall not have been convicted of or forfeited bond for two or
more moving traffic offenses;
      (10)    Such applicant, within three years prior to filing the
application for a license, shall not have been convicted of a criminal offense
involving public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency or moral
turpitude;
      (11)    Statements concerning such qualifications must be supported by
the affidavits of two reputable citizens of the City.
   (b)    Each application for a taxicab driver's license shall be accompanied
by two unmounted and unretouched photographs of the applicant made during the
calendar year in which the application is made. One photograph shall be filed
with the Mayor. In the event that a license is issued to the applicant, one
photograph shall be securely attached to the license issued to such person
which shall be constantly posted in a conspicuous place in any taxicab which
the licensee is operating. The City may furnish pictures at a nominal cost to
be determined by the Mayor.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.06  REQUIREMENTS FOR TAXICAB OWNER/OPERATOR LICENSE.
   (a)    An applicant for the initial issuance or renewal of a taxicab owner/
operator license shall meet the following requirements:
      (1)    Be an American citizen and be able to speak and read the English
language;
      (2)    Be able to provide the taxicab service required by Section
773.18, and obtain the liability insurance required by Section
773.11; and
      (3)    Possess a working knowledge of the traffic laws of the City and
State of Ohio;
      (4)    Such applicant must be of good character;
      (5)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
constituting a felony.
      (6)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
involving the use, possession of or sale of a controlled substance;
      (7)    Such applicant shall not be involved in a pending court action for
any criminal offense;
      (8)    Such applicant, within two years prior to filing the application
for a license, shall not have been convicted of or forfeited bond for two or
more moving traffic offenses;
      (9)    Such applicant, within three years prior to filing the application
for a license, shall not have been convicted of a criminal offense involving
public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency or moral turpitude;
      (10)    Such applicant, if a corporation, must be one which is authorized
to engage in the business of operating taxicabs under the law of Ohio.
      (11)    Statements concerning such qualifications must be supported by
the affidavits of two reputable citizens of the City.
         (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.07  LICENSE ISSUANCE; EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL.
   (a)    Upon approval of the application, the Mayor shall issue a license to
the applicant authorizing that person to drive a taxicab or to engage in the
business of operating a taxicab company, as the case may be.
   (b)    Taxicab owner/operator licenses shall include the following
information:
      (1)    The name of the applicant granted the license;
      (2)    The number of taxicabs the license holder may lawfully operate in
the City;
      (3)    A description of each taxicab being licensed by the license holder
including the year, make, model and VIN number;
      (4)    The name under which the license holder will conduct business. If
issued to a corporation or a partnership, the license shall be issued in the
name of the corporation or partnership and the name of the operator or manager
of said company;
      (5)    The principal place of business of the license holder;
      (6)    A statement that the license holder is subject to the rules and
regulations contained in this chapter.
   (c)    All licenses shall expire one year after the date of issue, unless
sooner revoked.
   (d)    All applications for renewal of licenses shall be filed with the
Mayor within one month of date of expiration of each year, and renewal licenses
shall be issued in the same manner and upon the same conditions as prescribed
herein for initial licenses.
   (e)    No new taxicab licenses shall be issued by the Mayor to an existing
owner/operator when the total number of taxicabs licensed by said owner/
operator would exceed 15 in number.
   (f)    No new owner/operator licenses shall be issued by the Mayor, for new
taxicab companies, when the total number of owner/operator licenses (i.e.
taxicab companies) would exceed 4 in number, unless and until Council shall, by
ordinance or resolution authorize the issuance of additional owner/operator
licenses.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
   (g)   Any new owner of a taxicab company must maintain a minimum of four (4)
taxicabs.  (Ord. 44, 2007.  Passed 11-5-07.)
773.08  LICENSE FEE SCHEDULE.
   (a)    The annual fee for a taxicab driver's license shall be twenty-five
dollars ($25.00).
   (b)    The annual fee for a taxicab owner/operator license shall be fifty
dollars ($50.00) per taxicab.
   (c)    All fees shall be payable into the City treasury and credited to the
general fund.
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.09  LICENSE DENIAL; APPEALS BOARD AND PROCEDURE.
   (a)    License Denial. A taxicab driver's license or a taxicab owner/
operator license may not be issued to any person who:
      (1)    Has been convicted, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for any
offense constituting a felony;
      (2)    Has been convicted, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for any
offense involving the use, possession of or sale of controlled substance;
      (3)    Has been adjudged mentally incompetent and has not been legally
restored to competency;
      (4)    Is awaiting court action for any criminal offense;
      (5)    Is subject to any infirmity, defect or disorder of mind or body
which might reasonably render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the
duties of a taxicab driver, or a taxicab owner/operator as determined by the
Mayor from all reliable medical, psychological or health information supplied
by the applicant or other persons concerning the applicant's physical or mental
condition;
      (6)    Has compiled an unsafe driving record, or a record of arrests that
exhibits a disregard for the law;
      (7)    Within two years prior to filing the application for a license has
been convicted of, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for two or more moving
traffic offenses, whether charged under State law or ordinances of any
jurisdiction;
      (8)    Within three years prior to filing the application for a license
has been convicted of, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for one or more
misdemeanors involving public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency or
moral turpitude.
   (b)    Notification of Denial. If a license is denied or refused, the Mayor
shall cause written notification of such denial or refusal to be given to the
applicant by certified mail at the address stated in the application, and such
written notification shall include the basis for such denial or refusal, and
shall advise the applicant of the procedure for appeal.
   (c)    Board Created. A taxicab license Appeals Board is hereby created and
shall consist of the Safety-Service Director, who shall be the Chairperson, the
Chief of Police and the City Law Director, or their duly authorized
representatives. A majority of the members of the Board shall constitute a
quorum.
   (d)    Appeals Procedure.
      (1)    Any applicant who has been denied or refused a taxicab driver's
license or a taxicab owner/operator license may request and shall be granted a
hearing on the matter before the Board by submitting a written request for a
hearing to the Mayor within ten days after the service of the notice of denial
or refusal. The written request for a hearing shall set forth the name, address
and telephone number of the applicant, and a brief statement of the grounds
for appeal. Upon receipt of a request for a hearing, the Mayor shall deliver
copies thereof to the Safety-Service Director, Chief of Police and Law
Director, and shall set a time and place for the hearing before the Board. The
Mayor shall give the applicant written notice of the hearing by certified mail
at least ten days prior to the date set for the hearing, which shall be
commenced within a reasonable time after a request has been filed.
      (2)    At such hearing, the applicant shall be given an opportunity to be
heard and to show cause why he/she believes the license should be issued. The
Mayor or designee shall also be given an opportunity to be heard and to state
the reasons why he believes the license should not be issued. The failure of
the applicant or his/her representative to appear and state their case at such
hearing shall have the same effect as if no request for a hearing had been
filed.
      (3)    After the hearing, the Board may, by a majority vote, sustain or
deny the appeal, and the applicant shall be notified in writing of such
decision and the reasons therefor.
      (4)    The proceedings at such hearing, including the decisions of the
Board, and the reasons for the decision shall be summarized and reduced to
writing and entered as a matter of public record in the office of the Mayor.
   (d)    Board Meetings and Enforcement. The Board shall meet from time to
time when it is deemed necessary by any member of the Board, to review the
administration and enforcement of the provisions in Sections
773.01  through
773.99 , and for any other purpose related to the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.10  TAXICAB OWNER/OPERATOR LICENSE DISPLAY AND TRANSFER.
   (a)    The taxicab owner/operator license or a copy thereof shall be placed
so as to be visible to all passengers.
   (b)    No taxicab owner/operator or taxicab driver shall operate or use any
taxicab as such unless the owner/operator license is affixed in the manner
above provided, or to operate or use any taxicab as such with any license other
than the license assigned to that taxicab.
   (c)    A taxicab owner/operator license may be transferred upon application
filed with the Mayor by the person, firm or corporation to whom it is proposed
to be transferred. Provided however, that such person, firm or corporation
shall meet and comply with all the requirements as set forth in this Section.
   (d)    The application for transfer shall be accompanied by a written
statement from the person, firm or corporation holding such license indicating
their agreement to such transfer.
   (e)   The request shall contain the taxicab number on the license proposed
to be transferred and the serial number of the taxicab from which and to which
the transfer is to be made. The written consent of the Mayor to the transfer
shall be endorsed upon the license of the taxicab owner/operator and upon the
records of the City Building.
   (f)    The transfer fee shall be ten dollars ($10) for each owner/operator
license so transferred.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.11  LIABILITY INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   (a)    Every applicant for a taxicab owner/operator license, as required by
Section
773.06, shall exhibit and file with the Mayor a policy or certificate of
commercial liability insurance for each taxicab for which a license is sought,
issued by an insurance company licensed and admitted to do business in the
State of Ohio.
   (b)    The policy or certificate of liability insurance must cover both
passengers and third parties and shall “pay on behalf of” the insured:
      (1)    Provide uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage of not less
than state minimum coverage as prescribed by Ohio law;
      (2)    Deleting any exclusions, limitations or exceptions as follows:
"when the vehicle is being used as a public livery or conveyance";
      (3)    The policy or certificate shall further contain a warranty by the
insurance company that in the event of any cancellation, non-renewal or
material change in the terms and conditions of such policy, the Mayor shall be
given at least ten days advance notice in writing;
      (4)    The policy shall remain in full force and effect during the entire
licensing period;
      (5)    The policy shall further provide that the insolvency or bankruptcy
of the insured shall not release the insurance company from payment required to
be made by the policy otherwise, but shall remain in full force and effect, and
available to any person damaged the same as though the licensee was not
insolvent or bankrupt;
      (6)    The policy shall be renewed annually to the satisfaction of the
Mayor.
      (7)   The City/Mayor/Mayor’s designee must be notified if any change(s)
in liability insurance status occurs.
         (Ord. 44, 2007.  Passed 11-5-07.)
773.12  IDENTIFICATION OF VEHICLES AND OWNERS.
   Every taxicab licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall have the
name of the owner and the word "cab" or "taxi" plainly printed in letters at
least two inches in height on both front doors of the vehicle.  (Ord. 72,
1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.13  INSPECTION OF TAXICABS; FEE.
   No owner/operator of any taxicab operated under the terms and provisions of
this chapter shall fail to exhibit to the Mayor's office an inspection of the
vehicle to be licensed at the time of license application and renewal. The
inspection shall be done at the expense of the applicant/owner, by a certified
private mechanic, as designated and approved by the Mayor. An acceptable
inspection form may be obtained from the Mayor's office prior to the making of
application of an operator's license. The acceptance of an approved inspection
report shall in no way place liability on the City for the safe operation of
the taxicab. The Police Department of the City may for cause require a taxicab
operator/driver to obtain a new inspection of a taxicab where it appears to the
officer not to be in safe operating condition by his visual observation either
while parked or operating. Failure to provide such an inspection to the Mayor's
office within five (5) business days shall be grounds for the taxicab license
to be revoked until a satisfactory inspection is presented to the Mayor's
office. 
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.) 
773.14  FARE.
   The minimum fare rates for taxicabs licensed and operated within the City
shall be $2.00.
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.15  POSTING OF RATE SCHEDULES.
   The rates of fare and zones charged by a driver of a taxicab shall be posted
in a conspicuous place in the passenger compartment of such vehicle, and the
schedule showing such rates shall be printed in a type not smaller than
fourteen point primer type.
(Ord. 44, 2007.  Passed 11-5-07.)
773.16  RECEIPTS.
   The owner or driver of any taxicab shall deliver a receipt to the person
paying for the hire of such vehicle if such person shall demand it. Such
receipt shall be delivered at the time of the payment of the fare and shall
show the point at which such person was accepted as a passenger and the place
where he was discharged.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.) 
773.17  ADVANCE PAYMENT.
   The owner or driver of any taxicab may request payment of any estimated fare
in advance of transportation of any passenger, and, if such is done, such fare
must be paid before service is furnished.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.18  TAXICAB SERVICE TO BE CONTINUOUS.
   All taxicab owner/operators shall:
   (a)   Provided taxicab service on a twenty-four hours a day, seven days a
week basis, with the exception of extraordinary unforeseen circumstances beyond
their control;
   (b)    Maintain a business office which shall be kept open at all times to
receive calls and dispatch taxicabs;
   (c)    Respond to all requests for service as soon as possible, and in the
event that service cannot be furnished within a reasonable time, the operator
shall inform the prospective passenger of the reason for the delay and how long
it will be before service can be furnished.
   (d)    Accept requests for service anywhere within the City when taxicabs
are available for such service. Failure or refusal, except for conditions
beyond the control of the operator, to furnish continuous service, shall be
deemed a violation of this section, and the taxicab owner/operator license may
be suspended or revoked pursuant to the provisions of Section;
   (e)    Provide off-street parking for all unattended licensed taxicabs. This
provision shall not apply to any taxicab parked temporarily on the street for
purposes of taking on or letting off of passengers, and then only for a
sufficient length of time to accomplish such purpose.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed
11-16-98.)
773.19  DAILY CALL SHEET OR TRIP RECORD REQUIRED.
   Every taxicab driver shall keep an accurate daily call sheet or trip record
containing a complete record of the operation of each cab driven by him/her
each day and the fare charged, and turn this call sheet or trip record over to
the taxicab owner/operator at the end of his/her tour of duty.  (Ord. 72,
1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.20  SOLICITING PASSENGERS.
   No driver of any taxicab, nor any other person, while on the public streets
of the City or any other public place, shall solicit patrons or passengers for
such vehicle in any way other than in an ordinary tone or voice or by the
display of a sign attached to his vehicle. Such sign shall not be more than a
rectangle sixteen inches long and six inches high. No driver of any taxicab nor
any other person shall solicit patrons or passengers for such vehicle when more
than five feet away from his vehicle. No driver shall seek or solicit
employment by repeatedly or persistently driving his vehicle to and from any
theater, hotel, railway station or other place of public ingress or egress. 
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.21  DISPLAY OF PHOTOGRAPH AND TAXICAB DRIVER'S LICENSE NUMBER.
   Every taxicab driver shall place his/her taxicab driver's license with
photograph and taxicab driver's license number so as to be visible to all
passengers and with proper lighting.
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.22  RECORDS AND INSPECTION.
   The Mayor shall file and keep an indexed record of all drivers and owner/
operator applications, fees paid and licenses issued, together with the name
and address of the licensee and the name and address of his employer, which
record shall be open for inspection by the public at all reasonable times. 
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.23  LICENSE SUSPENSION/REVOCATION.
   (a)    The Mayor shall have the right and authority to suspend or revoke,
after notice and hearing, any taxicab driver's license or taxicab owner/
operator license issued under the provisions of Sections
773.03 to
773.08, inclusive, whenever just cause exists. Just cause includes, but is not
limited to the following:
      (1)    The licensee has violated any of the provisions of Sections
773.01 to
773.23, inclusive;
      (2)    The licensee's physical or mental condition become such as to
render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of a taxicab
driver or taxicab owner/operator.
      (3)    The licensee transports any person who, with the knowledge of such
licensee, was at the time of such transportation engaged in any illegal
activity;
      (4)    The licensee has intentionally given false answers to any
questions on his/her application for such license;
      (5)    The licensee permits a taxicab to be operated for hire by a person
not licensed as a taxicab driver by the City;
      (6)    The licensee has compiled an unsafe driving record, or a record of
arrests that exhibits a disregard of the law;
      (7)    The licensee fails to maintain all the general qualifications
applicable to the initial issuance of a license;
      (8)    The licensee has been convicted of, pled guilty to or forfeited
bond for any of the following offenses while operating a taxicab:
         A.    Driving while under the influence of alcohol or any drug of
abuse, or the combined influence of alcohol and any drug of abuse.
         B.    Violation of the driver's identification law;
         C.    Vehicular homicide;
         D.    Fleeing and eluding a police officer;
         E.    Reckless operation;
         F.    Leaving the scene of an accident; or
         G.    Any offense constituting a felony.
   (b)    After revocation of a taxicab driver's license or taxicab owner/
operator license hereunder, no application for the same type of license shall
be accepted or considered for a period of twelve months from the date of
revocation.
   (c)    A taxicab driver's license shall be deemed to be suspended or revoked
upon the suspension, revocation or expiration of the licensee's Ohio operator's
license, during the term of such suspension, revocation or expiration.
   (d)    In the event of a violation of any of the provisions in Sections
773.01 to
773.23, inclusive, which results in any emergency situation in which continued
operation by the taxicab driver endangers the health, welfare or safety of the
public, the Mayor may suspend any taxicab driver's license hereunder; any such
suspension may be made effective immediately and shall remain in force until a
hearing is held.
   (e)    Except for the emergency suspension of a license under subsection (d)
hereof, the provisions in Section
773.09 regarding written notification procedure for appeal, a hearing before
the Board, and a decision rendered by the Board, shall apply to any action
taken by the Mayor under this section.  (Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.24  REGULATION OF TAXICABS.
   (a)    Each taxicab shall have a minimum of three doors which are operable
at all times;
   (b)    Each taxicab shall carry an operable fire extinguisher, first aid kit
and operable emergency reflective signs which shall be used in case of
breakdown;
   (c)    Each taxicab shall have operable safety seatbelts for each passenger
and the driver;
   (d)    The maximum capacity for each taxicab shall be limited to the
manufacturer's specifications for that taxicab's make and model of vehicle. 
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
773.99  PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates any provision of Sections
773.03 is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
   (b)    Whoever violates any other provision of Chapter
773 for which no other penalty is provided, is guilty of a minor misdemeanor on
a first offense and misdemeanor of the fourth degree for subsequent offenses.
(Ord. 72, 1998.  Passed 11-16-98.)
CHAPTER 774
Pedicabs

Taxicabs - see BUS. REG. Ch
773
774.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For purposes of this chapter the following definitions shall apply:
   (a)   "Operator" means a person who operates a pedicab, including a person
who in any manner controls the direction or steering of a pedicab in the City.
   (b)   "Owner" means a person who owns a pedicab in the City.
   (c)   "Pedicab" means a pedal-powered public passenger bicycle used to
provide transport for hire upon which a person may ride, propelled by human
power, and is constructed in such a manner as to allow the carrying of one or
more passengers.
   (d)   "Pedicab Licensee" means a person with a license issued pursuant to
this chapter.
   (e)   "Principal place of business in the City of East Liverpool" means (1)
a location where the City may send, and the pedicab licensee shall accept,
notices of hearing or other notices from the City; and (2) a location where a
pedicab licensee maintains its business and financial records relating to the
licenses involved.
      (Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.02  SCOPE.
   (Left blank Intentionally)
774.03  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)    Owner/Operator License. No person, firm, partnership or corporation
shall engage in the business of owning or operating one or more pedicab
companies within the City without first procuring or renewing and maintaining
in full force and effect a pedicab owner/operator license, which license shall
be granted by the Mayor.
   (b)    Operator's License. No pedicab shall be operated by the driver within
the City without first procuring or renewing and maintaining in full force and
effect, a pedicab operator's license, which license shall be granted by the
Mayor and an operator's license issued by the State of Ohio.
   (c)    Use of Unlicensed Pedicabs Prohibited. No person as owner/operator of
a pedicab company shall permit the operation of, nor shall a taxicab driver
operate, an unlicensed pedicab for purposes of conveying passengers or
property, for hire, to any destination within the City.
   (d)    Nothing in this section shall affect the rights of the City to impose
or collect any other applicable tax upon the use or operation of a pedicab in
addition to the license fee.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.04  APPLICATION FOR LICENSE.
   (a)    Every person, firm, partnership or corporation desiring to drive a
pedicab, or to manage or engage in the business of operating a pedicab company
shall submit an application for the appropriate license to the Mayor on a form
provided for that purpose. The applicant shall answer all questions in the
application. When an application for a pedicab owner/operator license is made
on behalf of a corporation or partnership, the name, addresses, phone number
and e-mail addresses of all officers or partners shall be included.  The trade
name under which the business shall be operated shall also be stated.
   (b)    The licensee shall provide a pedicab that is in safe and proper
condition at the time the license is issued; and shall register the pedicab in
applicant's name or, in the case of a leased pedicab, shall provide a copy of
the lease, in a form acceptable to the Mayor's office, that must cover at least
the duration of the license for the pedicab and must include an acknowledgement
by the lessor of the pedicab that he has given his consent for the pedicab to
be used as a licensed pedicab.
   (c)    Upon receipt of the application, the Mayor shall cause to be made
such investigation of the applicant as is necessary to determine whether the
applicant meets the requirements set forth in this chapter. 
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.05  REQUIREMENTS FOR PEDICAB OPERATOR'S LICENSE.
   (a)    An applicant for the initial issuance or renewal of a pedicab
operator's license shall meet the following requirements:
      (1)    Be an American citizen and able to speak and read the English
language;
      (2)    Be eighteen or more years of age;
      (3)    Be in sound physical condition, have good eyesight and not subject
to any infirmity, defect or disorder of mind or body which might reasonably
render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of duties of driving a pedicab,
as determined by the Mayor from all reliable medical, psychological or health
information supplied by the driver or other persons concerning the driver's
physical or mental condition.
      (4)    Possess a valid state operator's license;
      (5)    Such applicant must be of good character;
      (6)   Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
constituting a felony.
      (7)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
involving the use, possession of or sale of a controlled substance;
      (8)    Such applicant shall not be involved in a pending court action for
any criminal offense;
      (9)    Such applicant, within two years prior to filing the application
for a license, shall not have been convicted of or forfeited bond for two or
more moving traffic offenses;
      (10)    Such applicant, within three years prior to filing the
application for a license, shall not have been convicted of a criminal offense
involving public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency or moral
turpitude;
         (Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.06  REQUIREMENTS FOR PEDICAB OWNERS/OPERATOR LICENSE.
   (a)    An applicant for the initial issuance or renewal of a pedicab owner/
operator license shall meet the following requirements:
      (1)    Be an American citizen and be able to speak and read the English
language;
      (2)    Be able to obtain the liability insurance required by Section
774.13; and
      (3)    Possess a working knowledge of the traffic laws of the City and
state of Ohio;
      (4)    Such applicant must be of good character;
      (5)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
constituting a felony.
      (6)    Such applicant shall not have been convicted for any offense
involving the use, possession of or sale of a controlled substance;
      (7)    Such applicant shall not be involved in a pending court action for
any criminal offense;
      (8)   Such applicant, within two years prior to filing the application
for a license, shall not have been convicted of or forfeited bond for two or
more moving traffic offenses.
      (9)   Such applicant, within three years prior to filing the application
for a license, shall not have been convicted of a criminal offense involving
public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency or moral turpitude;
      (10)    Such applicant, if a corporation, must be one which is authorized
to engage in the business of operating pedicabs under the law of Ohio.
         (Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.07  LICENSE ISSUANCE; EXPIRATION AND RENEWAL.
   (a)    Upon approval of the application, the Mayor shall issue a license to
the applicant authorizing that person to drive a pedicab or to engage in the
business of operating a pedicab company, as the case may be.
   (b)    Pedicab owner/operator licenses shall include the following
information:
      (1)    The name of the applicant granted the license;
      (2)    The number of pedicabs the license holder may lawfully operate in
the City;
      (3)   A description of each pedicab being licensed by the license holder.
      (4)    The name under which the license holder will conduct business. If
issued to a corporation or a partnership, the license shall be issued in the
name of the corporation of partnership and the name of the operator or manager
of said company.
      (5)    The principal place of business of the license holder.
      (6)   A statement that the license holder is subject to the rules and
regulations contained in this chapter.
      (7)    A current decal as defined in Section
774.11.
   (c)    All licenses shall expire one year after the date of issue, unless
sooner revoked.
   (d)    All applications for renewal of licenses shall be filed with the
Mayor within one month of date of expiration of each year, and renewal licenses
shall be issued in the same manner and upon the same conditions as prescribed
herein for initial licenses.
   (e)    No new owner/operator license shall be issued for more than one
pedicab company unless there is a proven need. City Council may approve the
request to make changes to this section if deemed appropriate.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.08  LICENSE FEE SCHEDULE.
   (a)    The annual fee for a pedicab operator's license shall be ten dollars
($10.00) and shall not be prorated.
   (b)    The annual fee for a pedicab/owner operator license shall be twenty-
five dollars ($25.00) per pedicab.
   (c)    All fees shall be payable into the City treasury and credited to the
general fund.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.09  LICENSE DENIAL; APPEALS BOARD AND PROCEDURE.
   (a)    License Denial. A pedicab operator's license or a pedicab owner/
operator license may not be issued to any person who:
      (1)    Has been convicted, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for any
offense constituting a felony;
      (2)    Has been convicted, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for any
offense involving the use, possession of or sale of controlled substance.
      (3)    Has been adjudged mentally incompetent and has not been legally
restored to competency;
      (4)    Is awaiting court action for any criminal offense;
      (5)    Is subject to any infirmity, defect or disorder of mind or body
which might reasonably render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the
duties of a pedicab driver, or a pedicab owner/operator as determined by the
Mayor from all reliable medical, psychological or health information supplied
by the applicant or other persons concerning the applicant's physical or mental
condition;
      (6)    Has compiled an unsafe driving record, or a record of arrests that
exhibits a disregard for the law;
      (7)    Within two years prior to filing the application for a license has
been convicted of, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for two or more moving
traffic offenses, whether charged under State law or ordinances of any
jurisdiction;
      (8)    Within three years prior to filing the application for a license
has been convicted of, pled guilty to or forfeited bond for one or more
misdemeanors involving public disorder, violence, theft, public indecency or
moral turpitude.
   (b)    Notification of Denial. If a license is denied or refused, the Mayor
shall cause written notification of such denial or refusal to be given to the
applicant by certified mail at the address stated in the application, and such
written notification shall include the basis for such denial or refusal, and
shall advise the applicant of the procedure for appeal.
   (c)    Board Created. A pedicab license Appeals Board is hereby created and
shall consist of the Safety-Service Director, who shall be the Chairperson, the
Chief of Police and the City Law Director, or their duly authorized
representatives. A majority of the members of the Board shall constitute a
quorum.
   (d)    Appeals Procedure.
      (1)    Any applicant who has been denied or refused a pedicab operator's
license or a pedicab owner/operator license may request and shall be granted a
hearing on the matter before the Board by submitting a written request for a
hearing to the Mayor within ten days after the service of the notice of denial
or refusal.
   The written request for a hearing shall set forth the name, address and
telephone number of the applicant, and a brief statement of the grounds for
appeal. Upon receipt of a request for a hearing, the Mayor shall deliver copies
thereof to the Safety-Service Director, Chief of Police and Law Director, and
shall set a time and place for the hearing before the Board. The Mayor shall
give the applicant written notice of the hearing by certified mail at least ten
days prior to the date set for the hearing, which shall be commenced within a
reasonable time after a request has been filed.
      (2)    At such hearing, the applicant shall be given an opportunity to be
heard and to show cause why he/she believes the license should be issued. The
Mayor or designee shall also be given an opportunity to be heard and to state
the reasons why he believes the license should not be issued. The failure of
the applicant or his/her representative to appear and state their case at such
hearing shall have the same effect as if no request for a hearing had been
filed.
      (3)    After the hearing, the Board may, by a majority vote, sustain or
deny the appeal, and the applicant shall be notified in writing of such
decision and the reasons therefor.
      (4)    The proceedings at such hearing, including the decisions of the
Board, and the reasons for the decision shall be summarized and reduced to
writing and entered as a matter of public record in the office of the Mayor.
   (e)    Board Meetings and Enforcements. The Board shall meet from time to
time when it is deemed necessary by any member of the Board, to review the
administration and enforcement of the provisions in Section
774.01 through
774.99, and for any other purpose related to the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.10  PEDICAB OPERATOR'S IDENTIFICATION BADGE.
   (a)    The Mayor's office shall issue an identification badge to a pedicab
operator who has received a pedicab operator's permit. A photograph shall be
attached to the identification badge.
   (b)    While a pedicab is in operation, the operator shall wear the
identification badge at all times, in a manner clearly visible to the public.
   (c)    A pedicab operator's permit is non-transferrable.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.11  PEDICAB OWNER/OPERATOR LICENSE DECAL REQUIRED.
   (a)    It is unlawful for any person to operate or cause to be operated a
pedicab unless the pedicab has been licensed and issued a pedicab license decal
by the Mayor's office pursuant to this section. The Mayor or his designee shall
provide a pedicab license decal to a pedicab licensee once the licensee has
obtained a pedicab license and met the requirements of this chapter.
   
   (b)    A pedicab license decal will be issued only for a pedicab that meets
all of the following requirements:
      (1)    The pedicab must be no more than 55" wide and 120" long.
      (2)    The pedicab shall be equipped with:
         A.   A functioning headlight capable of projecting a beam of white
light for a distance of 500 feet;
         B.   Functioning taillights mounted on the right and the left,
respectively, at the same level on the rear exterior of the passenger
compartment. Taillights shall be red in color and plainly visible from all
distances within 500 feet to the rear of the pedicab;
         C.   Hydraulic or mechanical disc or drum brakes, which are state of
the art.
         D.   Spoke or wheel rim reflectors on each wheel and reflective tape
showing the back and front width of the pedicab;
         E.   A seatbelt or seatbelts for every passenger that secure the
passengers in a safe manner to prevent personal injuries;
         F.   Turn lights;
         G.   A bell or another similar audible signaling device; and
         H.   Such other equipment as required by rules and regulations
promulgated by the Mayor.
   (c)    The fee for the issuance or replacement of a pedicab license decal is
$10.00 per
pedicab.
   (d)    A pedicab decal is non-transferrable. A pedicab license decal is
valid for the duration of the pedicab license. If a pedicab license is not
renewed on time, or the pedicab license is no longer valid, or the required
insurance lapses, the pedicab license decal shall be void.
   (e)    Each pedicab license decal shall be numbered and the number of the
pedicab license decal shall be painted or affixed on the side and back of each
pedicab pursuant to rules and regulations promulgated by the Mayor. It shall be
the responsibility of the licensee to paint or affix such number on the
pedicab.
   (f)    To register a pedicab and secure a pedicab license decal, the pedicab
licensee must provide a unique identification number associated with the
pedicab, such as a manufacturer's stamp on the bottom bracket; or if there
exists no stamp, the licensee must inscribe or engrave a unique identification
number on the bottom bracket, and provide such unique identification number to
the Mayor's office.
   (g)    If the licensee decides to change a pedicab within the licensing
period, the licensee must submit a written request to the Mayor's office and
register the new pedicab. The Mayor or his designee shall provide a new pedicab
license decal of the same number and remaining duration as the original pedicab
license decal at a replacement fee of $10.00.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
744.12  RECORDS.
   Every licensee engaged in a pedicab business shall keep and provide accurate
books and records of account of his/her operations for a minimum of three
years. Such records must be submitted upon the request of the Mayor.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.13  INSURANCE REQUIRED.
   (a)   Every licensee must comply with all applicable insurance requirements
mandated by Federal, State and City laws.
   (b)   Each applicant for the issuance or renewal of a pedicab license shall
provide proof that the applicant has public liability and property damage
insurance, issued by an insurer authorized to insure in Ohio, to secure payment
by the applicant of any final judgment or settlement of any claim against the
applicant, operators, employees, or lessees of the applicant’s bedicab business
resulting from any occurrence arising out of or caused by the operation or use
of any of the applicant’s pedicab(s).  Every insurance policy or contract for
such insurance shall name the City as an additional insured.
   (c)   Such insurance policy shall provide at least the following minimum
coverage for each pedicab; $50,000.00 for property damage; $100,000.00 for
injuries to or death of any one person; and $300,000.00 for injuries to or
death of more than one person in any one accident with a maximum of $100,000.00
payable to any one person.  In addition, worker’s compensation coverage must be
provided as required by state law.
   (d)   Any insurance policy required by this section must be in a form
satisfactory to the Mayor and must provide that the policy will not be
cancelled and the amount of coverage will not be changed unless 60 days’ prior
written notice is given to the Mayor’s office.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.14  OPERATING REGULATIONS.
   (a)   It shall be unlawful for any person:
      (1)   Who is under the age of eighteen years to operate a pedicab;
      (2)   To operate a pedicab while under the influence of alcoholic
beverages or controlled substances other than medication prescribed by a
physician, provided that such prescribed medication does not warn that the user
not operate machinery while taking the medication.
      (3)   To operate a pedicab in any manner which impeded or blocks the
normal or reasonable movement of pedestrian or vehicular traffic unless such
operation is necessary for sale operation.
      (4)   To operate, or cause to be operated, a pedicab in any area where
the operation of a pedicab is prohibited by applicable law;
      (5)   To operate a pedicab within the City while not in possession of a
valid driver’s license issued by the State of Ohio, or a valid driver’s license
of another state, district or territory of the United States.
      (6)   To operate, or cause to be operated, a pedicab within the City
while not in possession of proof of insurance as outlined in Section
774.13 of this chapter.
      (7)   To operate, or cause to be operated, a pedicab while there is
attached thereto any additional trailer or any other passenger-carrying
vehicle; or
      (8)   To operate, or cause to be operated, a pedicab to transport more
than four passengers, unless pedicab is designed for more passengers; and
      (9)   To operate a pedicab upon any sidewalk.
   (b)   The operator shall require that all passengers remain seated
throughout the ride.
   (c)    Advertisements may be displayed on the exterior and the interior of a
pedicab.
   (d)    No person may drink any alcoholic liquor as defined by law while such
person is operating or being transported by a pedicab, nor may any person
transport, carry, possess or have any alcoholic liquor while being transported
by a pedicab, except in the original package with the seal unbroken.  (Ord. 45,
2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.15  RECORDS.
   Every licensee engaged in a pedicab business shall keep and provide accurate
books and records of account of his/her operations for a minimum of three
years.  Such records must be submitted upon the request of the Mayor. 
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.16  FARE SCHEDULE AND SIGNAGE.
   (a)    It is unlawful for a pedicab operator to demand from a passenger a
fare greater than the fare contained in the posted fare schedule.
   (b)    Subsection (b) of this section does not apply to fares for special
tours, provided that the fare for the special tour is agreed upon between the
passenger and the operator prior to the beginning of the tour.
   (c)    Pedicab licensees shall post on each pedicab signage identifying the
licensee. This signage shall be clearly visible to the public at all times.
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.17  LICENSE SUSPENSION/REVOCATION.
   (a)    The Mayor shall have the right and authority to suspend or revoke,
after notice and hearing, any pedicab operator's license or pedicab owner/
operator license issued under the provisions of Sections
774.03 to
774.08, inclusive, whenever just cause exists. Just cause includes, but is not
limited to the following:
      (1)    The licensee has violated any of the provisions of Sections
774.01 to
774.17, inclusive;
      (2)    The licensee's physical or mental condition become such as to
render him/her unfit for the safe carrying out of the duties of a pedicab
operator or pedicab owner/operator.
      (3)    The licensee transports any person who, with the knowledge of such
licensee, was at the time of such transportation engaged in any illegal
activity;
      (4)    The licensee has intentionally given false answers to any
questions on his/her application for such license;
      (5)    The licensee permits a pedicab to be operated for hire by a person
not licensed as a pedicab operator by the City;
      (6)    The licensee has compiled an unsafe driving record, or a record of
arrests that exhibits a disregard of the law;
      (7)    The licensee fails to maintain all the general qualifications
applicable to the initial issuance of a license;
      (8)    The licensee has been convicted of, pled guilty to or forfeited
bond for any of the following offenses while operating a pedicab:
         A.    Driving while under the influence of alcohol or any drug of
abuse, or the combined influence of alcohol and any drug of abuse.
         B.    Violation of the driver's identification law;
         C.    Vehicular homicide;
         D.    Fleeing and eluding a police officer;
         E.    Reckless operation;
         F.    Leaving the scene of an accident; or
         G.    Any offense constituting a felony.
   (b)    After revocation of a pedicab operator's license or a pedicab owner/
operator license hereunder, no application for the same type of license shall
be accepted or considered for a period of twelve months from the date of
revocation.
   (c)    A pedicab operator's license shall be deemed to be suspended or
revoked upon the suspension, revocation or expiration of the licensee's Ohio
Operator's license, during the term of such suspension, revocation or
expiration.
   (d)    In the event of a violation of any of the provisions in Sections
774.01 to
774.17, inclusive, which results in any emergency situation in which continued
operation by the pedicab driver endangers the health, welfare or safety of the
public, the Mayor may suspend any pedicab operator's license hereunder; any
such suspension may be made effective immediately and shall remain in force
until a hearing is held.
   
   (e)    Except for the emergency situation of a license under subsection (d)
hereof, the provisions in Section
774.09 regarding written notification procedure for appeal, a hearing before
the Board, and a decision rendered by the Board, shall apply to any action
taken by the Mayor under this section. (Ord. 45, 2015.  Passed 9-8-15.)
774.99  PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates any provision of Section
774.03 is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
   (b)    Whoever violates any other provision of Chapter
774 for which no other penalty is provided, is guilty of a minor misdemeanor on
a first offense and misdemeanor of the fourth degree for subsequent offenses. 
(Ord. 45, 2015.  Passe 9-8-15.)
